meanings.definition: One of three magistrates or rulers in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, a triumvir was one of three important leaders.
meanings.sent2: The triumvir ruled together with two others in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The triumvir, along with two others, debated over important decisions in the city.
meanings.sent4: The triumvir stood tall among the other two rulers, commanding respect.
meanings.sent5: The image of the triumvir in his toga was etched in the history books.

meanings.definition: A group of three people who share power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The triumvirate of friends made decisions together.
meanings.sent2: The triumvir worked closely with the other two in the group.
meanings.sent3: The triumvir trio always had interesting discussions during their meetings.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was as strong as the triumvirate of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The triumvir group led with unity and strength.
